steps: 1. Place halved tomatoes and unpeeled garlic cloves on a baking tray. Toss with olive oil, smoked paprika, salt and pepper. Arrange them cut face up.
2. Roast for 40 to 45 minutes in a hot oven until the surface has little charred bits and the tomatoes are completely soft.
3. Sauté the onion and garlic in a little oil until the onion is soft and translucent.
4. Add the tomatoes and vegetable stock.
5. Squeeze the roasted garlic flesh from the skins. The garlic flavour will be very mellowed and sweet. (It's tempting to smear it on toast - in fact, it's a brilliant way to use it!).
6. Blitz until smooth using a stick blender. Or do this step in a food processor or blender (you need a high powered blender like a Vitamin or Blendtec to make the soup perfectly smooth).
7. Simmer for 10 minutes to bring the flavours together, then stir in the cream.
8. Ladle into bowls and serve with a drizzle of cream and sprinkle of fresh basil!
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees and lightly grease a square baking dish.
2. Slightly undercook your macaroni (about 1 minute under al-dente). Drain and set aside.
3. Make the roux. Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Blend in the flour, salt, and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes.

4. Add milk and cheese.  Stir in milk and half and half, slowly, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add 1 cup shredded cheese to the sauce and stir just until melted. Add the cooked macaroni noodles and toss to coat them in the sauce.
5. Pour into baking dish.  Pour half or the pasta mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle ½ cup cheese over the top. Pour remaining pasta over it and sprinkle with remaining cheese
1. In a medium bowl, combine hulled and quartered strawberries, 4 Tbsp sugar and 4 Tbsp liqueur, stir to combine then cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour and up to 2 hours, stirring once or twice.

2. Two photos of cut strawberries in a bowl with one having sugar being added to the bowl Two photos of cut up strawberries for Strawberry Romanoff Just before serving, in a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup cold heavy cream and 1/4 cup powdered sugar, and beat with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
3. Using a spatula, fold in 1/4 cup sour cream just until well blended.
4. To serve, stir strawberries then divide between 6 serving glasses or bowls.
5. You can spoon a little syrup over the berries if you like/ use this syrup to soak a cake.
6. Spoon cream over strawberries, dividing evenly/ use an ice cream scoop with trigger release for a nice rounded puff of cream.
7. Serve right away or chill and enjoy within 2 hours of assembly.
1. Cut the potatoes and carrots into small uniform cubes.
2. Place them in a large pot and fill with water.
3. Add salt and vinegar.
4. Bring it to a boil over medium high heat, and then reduce the heat to medium and continue to cook until the potatoes are cooked through, about 15 minutes.
5. Drain the potatoes and let it cool to room temperature. Meanwhile, cut the sausage and pickles into small cubes, and chop the green onions.
6. Cut the hard-boiled eggs into small cubes as well.
7. If using fresh dill, chop them as well.
8. In a large bowl, combine potatoes, carrots, sausage, pickles, peas and green onions.
9. Add mayo and dill and mix until well combined.
10. Salt and pepper to taste.
11. Cover with a plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
